medical_history.chief_complaint: Progressive right knee pain and severe genu valgum.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient had progressive right knee pain with limited ambulation due to pain and instability requiring bilateral knee braces and T-canes. Symptoms were uncorrected by manual stress. She was unaware of her bilateral dislocation condition.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient underwent orthotic treatment for left congenital dislocation of the hip at birth, total hip arthroplasty for ipsilateral hip osteoarthritis at age 55, and revision surgery for aseptic loosening of the cup at age 69. No history of trauma or knee surgery.
